title: Katie Price claims driving ban is ‘b*****ks’ and due to lost post
text:
Katie Price has hit out at her two-year driving ban, claiming the police pull her over to ‘be nosy’ when she’s driving her bright pink Range Rover.

The former glamour model slammed the ban as ‘b*****ks’, as she claimed the reason her license has been suspended was that her post was being delivered to the wrong house.

She revealed on her YouTube channel: ‘I’ve been banned now four times from driving, but it’s actually not [to do with] me driving, it’s to do with paperwork.

‘I apparently was [due] in court yesterday and my lawyers said to the court that I would not be there as I’d be out the country. We proved we’d be out the country, but the judge wasn’t even interested in adjourning it.

‘Why? Because I believe they have it in for me. I just want to clarify something. Where I live, there is five houses all around me and we all have the same postcode but we all have a different name on our house.’

Advertisement

Katie, 41, added: ‘So this is what happens to me, some people write to me but I don’t always get it on time. It’s got my name and my postcode – but the wrong house.

‘It happens a lot, parking tickets, court stuff, police stuff, anything, bills. Now when I go to court and say I don’t always get my post the court don’t want to hear that.

Katie claims police pull her over due to her unmistakable pink car (Picture: Instagram)

‘Not only that, but I need to drive and I am going to appeal. I live in the middle of nowhere, I have a son with disabilities that might need to be rushed to hospital at certain times.

‘My mum is terminally ill and I need to visit my mum. If they’re banning me for two years, how do I know my mum is going to be here in two years’ time? I need to be able to get to my mum.

‘It’s obscene that the courts won’t listen just because they banned me before three times, which was also unfair.’

Katie gave her opinion on the driving ban on YouTube, branding it ‘b*****ks’ (Picture: Katie Price/YouTube)

She added that she thinks her ban is ‘b*****ks’ and overly harsh, explaining: ‘I have builders inside my house, my post gets moved here, there and everywhere, so at the moment I don’t get all my post so I am going to appeal my driving ban.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It’s obscene, being banned for two years. Two years is a long time and I don’t deserve it at all, it’s a load of b*****ks. Everyone says my pink Range Rover is gone but I still have it, I just don’t drive it.

‘Well, I can’t now because people like the police do pull me over and I’m like “what have I done”, and their attitude is ‘’what’s with the attitude’’ and I’m like “why have you pulled me over?”

‘It’s just ‘cos they want to be nosey, what other person has a pink car in my area? They know it’s me.’

The mother of five was banned from the road for two years after she failed to attend a court hearing and was charged with withholding the name of the driver of her car after it was involved in a collision last November.

Her lawyers wrote to the court to postpone the hearing on 10 October as she was due to fly back to the UK on that date, but the judge refused to delay it further.

District Judge Robert Hunter told Bexley Magistrates’ Court: ‘This hearing has already been adjourned once. This date was agreed by both sides. I am not inclined to further adjourn this matter.’

Advertisement

As well as being banned from driving with 12 points on her license, Katie was also given a £440 fine, a £44 surcharge and ordered to pay £100 in costs.
